ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style and formatting

rule.name: PreferStringJoinOverConcatenation
rule.message: Multiple string concatenations with a common separator should use String.join() for better readability and maintainability
rule.description:
When concatenating a minimum number of strings where all strings except the last end with the same non-empty sequence of characters, use String.join() for better readability and maintainability.
Use: String.join(new List < String > {'line1', 'line2', 'line3'}, '\n'); The second argument to String.join() should be the repeating separator pattern (not an empty string).
To customize this rule, edit the minStrings threshold in the XPath expression (default: 3).

property.name: xpath
property.value: let $minStrings := 3 return //BinaryExpression[ @Op = '+' and BinaryExpression[@Op = '+'] and count(.//LiteralExpression[@String = true()]) >= $minStrings and not(ancestor::MethodCallExpression[@MethodName = 'join']) ]
